Preprocessor Class Reference

#include <Preprocessor.h>

Collaboration diagram for Preprocessor:

Detailed Description

Preprocessor of the OCR process.

This class encapsulates all the methods related to the stage of preprocessing. Its task is to enhance the image quality by applying some techniques of image preprocessing theory. By the way it has a several methods to obtain the elapsed time of every significant algorithm.

Remarks:
Note that every algorithm has been designed to work with a grayscale image. This means that, unless the method convertToGrayscale is invoked before, an implicit conversion to the grayscale colorspace is applied.
See also:
Clip
Author:
Eliezer Talón (elitalon@gmail.com)

2008-10-02

Definition at line 179 of file Preprocessor.cpp.

double Preprocessor::findBackgroundReferenceGrayLevel ( Clip &  clip,
const unsigned int &  referenceGrayLevelNeighbours = 4 
)

Computes the background reference gray level value within a clip.

To find the reference gray level of the background it is assumed that there are more pixels belonging to the background than beloging to the foreground. Then, we search the more frequent gray level and its neighbours. Finally, we compute a gray level weighted mean using all those values.

Parameters:
[in,out] clip The clip where applying the algorithm over
referenceGrayLevelNeighbours Number of the more frequent gray level neighbours to explore on each direction
Returns:
The reference gray level of the background
Author:
Eliezer Talón (elitalon@gmail.com)
Date:
2008-10-01

Definition at line 203 of file Preprocessor.cpp.

Referenced by removeIsolatedNoise().

void Preprocessor::removeIsolatedNoise ( Clip &  clip,
const unsigned int &  isolationCoefficient = 1 
)

Applies the 'isolated noise removal' algorithm.

The 'isolated noise removal' algorithm tries to eliminate isolated noisy pixels from an clip. The isolationCoefficient parameter defines how much isolated should be a noisy pixel to be removed. That means a noisy pixel will be removed whenever it has up to isolationCoefficient neighbours whose gray level is over a threshold value, which is controlled by the optimalThreshold attribute.

Remarks:
You MUST call Preprocessor::computeOptimalThreshold method before calling this, since the optimalThreshold attribute is used internally to know whether a pixel is noisy or not.
Parameters:
[in,out] clip The clip where applying the algorithm over
isolationCoefficient The maximum noisy neighbours for a pixel to consider it as isolated
Author:
Eliezer Talón (elitalon@gmail.com)
Date:
2008-10-02
